dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Host_B, I've been thinking a lot lately about, uh, this phrase I keep hearing: re-educating yourself for new realities. It feels super relevant right now, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Host B, I've been thinking a lot lately about, uh, this phrase I keep hearing: re-educating yourself for new realities. It feels super relevant right now, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Recently Ive regularly been quoting this phrase when talking about adapting to the new realities of global disruptions, global unknowns and strategic steps for future success.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely, Host_A. Like, with all the global disruptions, it’s not just about adapting, but strategically preparing. And the article really hammers home that foundation piece.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely, Host A. Like, with all the global disruptions, it's not just about adapting, but strategically preparing. And the article really hammers home that foundation piece.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The key in being able to efficiently deal with the growing wave of challenges around us is in re-educating yourself. Here are five strategic steps you can follow to re-educate yourself for new realities Work on your foundation

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! It's not like there’s a silver bullet for everything, right? But it does say we have tools. And the self-improvement gurus all agree on devoting time to self-reflection, especially for soft skills.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! It's not like there's a silver bullet for everything, right? But it does say we have tools. And the self-improvement gurus all agree on devoting time to self-reflection, especially for soft skills.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...our experience shows that we have no silver bullet to quickly fix the mounting problems that confront us; but we do have various tools to educate ourselves... I see a consensus among self-management and self-improvement gurus that it is strategically very important to devote some of your time to self-reflection in order to assess your most important asset yourself, especially your soft skills!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Which is so key, isn't it? Things like agility, motivation, emotional intelligence... uh, figuring out what people value most in *you*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is so key, isn't it? Things like agility, motivation, emotional intelligence... uh, figuring out what people value most in you.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You should identify, update and study the most critical soft skills that your boss, colleagues or friends value most about you (e.g., agility, motivation, emotional intelligence (EI), leadership).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. You gotta, like, make your own pyramid of what you need to develop. But then, it moves on to hard skills, which I found really interesting. The LinkedIn report they mentioned?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. You gotta, like, make your own pyramid of what you need to develop. But then, it moves on to hard skills, which I found really interesting. The LinkedIn report they mentioned?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its up to you to decide what you need (and want) to develop further by writing out a pyramid of the most in-demand soft skills... The recently released LinkedIn 2020 Workplace Learning Report comprised data from almost 500,000,000 professionals...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, that report was wild! Half a billion professionals' data, mapping out the most in-demand skills. And the skill gaps, especially in ICT, are just widening, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, that report was wild! Half a billion professionals' data, mapping out the most in-demand skills. And the skill gaps, especially in I C T, are just widening, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The recently released LinkedIn 2020 Workplace Learning Report comprised data from almost 500,000,000 professionals... it seems that in our rapidly changing world the skill gaps continue to widen, including information and communication technologies (ICT).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's not saying everyone needs to become a programmer, um, or an AI expert, but it's like, you *should* consider picking up some additional in-demand hard skills, right? For what's coming in the next year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's not saying everyone needs to become a programmer, um, or an A I expert, but it's like, you should consider picking up some additional in-demand hard skills, right? For what's coming in the next year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This does not mean that everyone should become a programmer or expert in artificial intelligence (AI); but it implies that everyone should consider mastering additional in-demand hard skills to be ready for the huge changes in the labor market that are foreseeable within the next 12 months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, like being ready for those huge labor market changes. And speaking of changes, remote work! That initial enthusiasm, uh, definitely wore off for a lot of people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, like being ready for those huge labor market changes. And speaking of changes, remote work! That initial enthusiasm, uh, definitely wore off for a lot of people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In many places, the enthusiasm of the first week of working from home office gave way to a collapse of productivity and emotional exhaustion after the second and third weeks onward.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure! Productivity collapse, emotional exhaustion. It's harder than it looks. All those new software tools, document sharing apps, and just, like, managing your time when your family keeps wandering into the kitchen during a call.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure! Productivity collapse, emotional exhaustion. It's harder than it looks. All those new software tools, document sharing apps, and just, like, managing your time when your family keeps wandering into the kitchen during a call.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...a collapse of productivity and emotional exhaustion... Many people discovered that it requires additional sets of sophisticated skills, including knowledge of the numerous new and existing kinds of software, document sharing apps and other online productivity tools. In addition, there is a need for meticulous time management and people management proficiencies (well, how to handle dexterously a situation when your entire family would like to come to the kitchen every time when you would like to focus on your urgent project or on a teleconference with your boss?).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] Or your cat! Yeah, the article really highlights the need for meticulous time management and even people management skills, even in your own home.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or your cat! Yeah, the article really highlights the need for meticulous time management and even people management skills, even in your own home.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition, there is a need for meticulous time management and people management proficiencies...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then, reinventing yourself online. That's huge. With social distancing, being visible professionally online is, like, non-negotiable now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then, reinventing yourself online. That's huge. With social distancing, being visible professionally online is, like, non-negotiable now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Reinventing yourself online In the era of social distancing, the only way to stay visible and close to your colleagues in your work field is to be active in social networking...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, spending an hour or two a day just polishing your LinkedIn, getting rid of those typos, making sure your profile is super professional. It makes a difference.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, spending an hour or two a day just polishing your LinkedIn, getting rid of those typos, making sure your profile is super professional. It makes a difference.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Many recent studies suggest that today people should spend at least 1-2 hours a day on the Internet and social media. What to achieve in this time? You should by polishing your bio and profile on LinkedIn and other professional and job search websites, and learning how to get rid of those small but annoying typos, sloppy sentences and incomplete thoughts and ideas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. It’s all part of, like, professionalizing your online presence. And finally, the article talks about learning about learning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. It's all part of, like, professionalizing your online presence. And finally, the article talks about learning about learning.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is important to reinvent yourself in cyberspace by updating and professionalizing your social networking, media marketing and social media communication skills. ... Learning about learning

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the MOOCs! So many options, but you gotta choose wisely, right? It's not just identifying gaps, but figuring out *how* to effectively use all those online tools to actually learn.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the M O O C s! So many options, but you gotta choose wisely, right? It's not just identifying gaps, but figuring out how to effectively use all those online tools to actually learn.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The opportunities for online learning are endless as thousands of universities and training organizations have launched massive open online courses (MOOCs) on hundreds of subjects! Refine your learning process by effectively using your carte blanche of MOOCs and all those online studying tools and platforms, to choose the most efficient courses, modules and programs to fit your specific needs...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It's a skill in itself, learning how to learn efficiently. So, really, it all comes back to being strategic about your own growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It's a skill in itself, learning how to learn efficiently. So, really, it all comes back to being strategic about your own growth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...to choose the most efficient courses, modules and programs to fit your specific needs: this itself is an additional set of skills to acquire!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, adapting to new realities is all about, uh, continuous self-improvement, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, adapting to new realities is all about, uh, continuous self-improvement, isn't it?
